abstract: Landline telephones that transmit their signals via long copper wires are going out of style just about everywhere, but they are alive and well in stadium dugouts throughout Major League Baseball.
snippet: Phones that transmit their signals via long copper wires are going out of style just about everywhere, but they are alive and well in stadium dugouts throughout baseball.
lead_paragraph: Phones that transmit their signals via long copper wires are going out of style just about everywhere, but they are alive and well in stadium dugouts throughout baseball.

headline.main: Dugout Phones: Last Bastion of the Landline
headline.print_headline: Refusing to Cut Cord to Past, Baseball Still Keeps Landlines in the Dugout
headline.seo: Dugout Phones: Last Bastion of the Landline
